meanings.definition: To bring under the control or influence of the media.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to mediatize their new product launch to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity's scandal was mediatized by tabloids all over the country.
meanings.sent3: When the cat accidentally knocked over the camera, it seemed to mediatize the whole living room.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter seemed to mediatize the entire room, spreading joy to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The breaking news story about the storm mediatized the urgency of the situation.

meanings.definition: To make something known through the media.
meanings.sent1: The politician wanted to mediatize his message to gain more supporters.
meanings.sent2: The press conference was a way to mediatize the company's upcoming charity event.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot seemed to mediatize its owner's secrets to the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The bright billboard mediatized the presence of the new store in the busy street.
meanings.sent5: The viral video quickly mediatized the hilarious dance moves of the toddler.
